Step 1:  <s>Make sure you are using a quality caulking. The best ones for cracks in concrete or brick are: Elasto-Glass, Flex Seal, or DAP.</s>

[INST] Start caulking one end of the crack and then work your way down to the other end.

[INST] When caulking around windows, door frames, etc., be sure that you are applying enough caulk at each joint so that it is just about full when you start the next joint.

[INST] Be sure not to overfill the joints, since this will cause the caulk to bulge out and eventually crack.

## Introduction

This guide will show you how to setup your own VPN server using OpenVPN on Ubuntu Server. We'll also be setting up a custom certificate authority (CA) and signing certificates for our clients.

OpenVPN is an SSL-based virtual private network solution that implements OSI layer 2 or 3 secure network extension using the industry standard SSL/TLS protocol, supports flexible client authentication and cipher options and provides several tunneling protocols.

A VPN server allows remote users to securely connect to their corporate networks over the Internet. The user's system connects directly to the VPN server; once connected it appears as if they were actually

=== [[#Using a string to select an object|Using a string to select an object]] ===

A string is composed of characters enclosed in double quotes. For example, "object_name" selects the named object.

To create strings:
- Type a single character and press {{Key|Shift|Tab}} or {{Key|Ctrl+Space}}.
- Select multiple characters by holding down one of the shift keys while typing the characters. To select all characters between two other characters (for example, "a" and "z"), type "

The following instructions are for the Linux operating system on a PC. If you are using another operating system, please consult your computer's documentation or ask in #nuxeo.

## Install Nuxeo from source

### Requirements

* Java 8 (OpenJDK should be OK)
* Maven
* Git

You can also install maven from its repository:

`sudo apt-get install maven`

Or download and run the.deb file ([download](http://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Download#Debian_(_apt_))).

[INST] The user is the owner of the file to be encrypted, and will enter a password for use with this program.

The user must have write access to the directory that contains the file to encrypt.



If there are files already in the same location as the one to be encrypted, they must be moved to another folder before encryption can take place. If not, those files will be encrypted along with the file you intend to protect.

To avoid any confusion, it's best practice to move all existing files to a different location (such as desktop).

Step 4:  The main purpose of the `--help` option is to make it easy for you to learn how to use a particular command. For example, if you are using `git help pull`, you will see something like the following:

    Usage: git pull [options] <repository> [<refspec>…​]
       -h, --help             show summary of options
       -v, --verbose          be more verbose

The above shows that there are two options `-h` and `-v`. These options are called flags in the Git world.

### Creating a Project

In order to create a new project with the **JEdit** IDE, open up the menu by clicking on the gear icon in the top-right corner and select "Create New Project." This will bring up the window shown below.

![CreateNewProject](/images/jedit-create-new-project.png)

Choose the location where you would like to store the project files for your application, and give it a name. Once you have done this, click Create.

You should now see a folder containing your new project's files appear next to the JEdit IDE. The structure of a typical project file will look similar to
Step 2: 
Step 3:  <s>**This page is for the current development version of Instaweb.**

The most recent stable version is available on SourceForge at:

[http://instaweb.sourceforge.net/](http://instaweb.sourceforge.net/)


</s>

Instaweb is a simple, lightweight web server which uses PHP scripts to provide dynamic content and serves static files from the local filesystem.

It aims to be easy to install and configure, requiring no database or other dependencies.
